maml:description.maml:para: Gets the details of an Analysis Services server.
The Get-AzureRmAnalysisServicesServer cmdlet gets the details of an Analysis Services server.

maml:Description.maml:para: Name of the Azure resource group to which the server belongs
Name of the Analysis Services server
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Name of the Analysis Services server
Name of the Azure resource group to which the server belongs

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command gets all Azure Analysis Services servers in the resource group named ResourceGroup03.
This command gets the Azure Analysis Services server named testserver in the resource group named ResourceGroup03.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Analysis Services firewall config
The New-AzureRmAnalysisServicesFirewallConfig creates a new firewall config object

maml:Description.maml:para: The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
A flag to indicate if the firewall is allowing access from Power BI
A list of firewall rules
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
A flag to indicate if the firewall is allowing access from Power BI
A list of firewall rules

command:example.maml:title: Example 1
command:example.dev:code: PS C:\> $rule1 = New-AzureRmAnalysisServicesFirewallRule -FirewallRuleName rule1 -RangeStart 0.0.0.0 -RangeEnd 255.255.255.255 PS C:\> $rule2 = New-AzureRmAnalysisServicesFirewallRule -FirewallRuleName rule2 -RangeStart 6.6.6.6 -RangeEnd 7.7.7.7 PS C:\> $config = New-AzureRmAnalysisServicesFirewallConfig -EnablePowerBIService -FirewallRule $rule1,$rule2

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a firewall config object with two rules while also enabling access from Power BI service.

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Analysis Services firewall rule
The New-AzureRmAnalysisServicesFirewallRule creates a new firewall rule object.

maml:Description.maml:para: Name of firewall rule
The range start of a firewall rule
The range end of a firewall rule
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with Azure.
Name of firewall rule
The range end of a firewall rule
The range start of a firewall rule

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a firewall rule named rule1 with start range 0.0.0.0 and end range 255.255.255.255

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new Analysis Services server
The New-AzureRmAnalysisServicesServer cmdlet creates a new Analysis Services server

maml:Description.maml:para: Name of the Azure resource group to which the server belongs
Name of the Analysis Services server
The Azure region where the Analysis Services server is hosted
The name of the Sku for the server. The supported values are 'S0', 'S1', 'S2', 'S4' for the Standard tier; 'B1', 'B2' for the Basic tier and 'D1' for Development tier.
Key-value pairs in the form of a hash table set as tags on the server.

A string representing a comma separated list of users or groups to be set as administrators on the server. The users or groups need to be specified UPN format e.g. user@contoso.com or groups@contoso.com
The blob container Uri for backup the Analysis Services server
Default connection mode of an Analysis service server
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Firewall config of an Analysis server
Gateway resource Id for assocaite to an Analysis server
Read only replica count of an Analysis service server
Prompts user to confirm whether to perform the operation
Describes the actions the current operation will perform without actually performing them

A string representing a comma separated list of users or groups to be set as administrators on the server. The users or groups need to be specified UPN format e.g. user@contoso.com or groups@contoso.com
The blob container Uri for backup the Analysis Services server
Default connection mode of an Analysis service server
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Firewall config of an Analysis server
Gateway resource Id for assocaite to an Analysis server
The Azure region where the Analysis Services server is hosted
Name of the Analysis Services server
Read only replica count of an Analysis service server
Name of the Azure resource group to which the server belongs
The name of the Sku for the server. The supported values are 'S0', 'S1', 'S2', 'S4' for the Standard tier; 'B1', 'B2' for the Basic tier and 'D1' for Development tier.
Key-value pairs in the form of a hash table set as tags on the server.
Prompts user to confirm whether to perform the operation
Describes the actions the current operation will perform without actually performing them

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a server named testserver in the Azure region West-US and in resource group testresrourcegroup. The sku level for the server will be S1.

maml:description.maml:para: Deletes an instance of Analysis Services server
The Remove-AzureRmAnalysisServicesServer cmdlet deletes an instance of Analysis Services server

maml:Description.maml:para: Name of the Analysis Services server
Name of the Azure resource group to which the server belongs
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Will return the deleted server details if the operation completes successfully
Prompts user to confirm whether to perform the operation
Describes the actions the current operation will perform without actually performing them
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Name of the Analysis Services server
Will return the deleted server details if the operation completes successfully
Name of the Azure resource group to which the server belongs
Prompts user to confirm whether to perform the operation
Describes the actions the current operation will perform without actually performing them

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will remove the server named testserver in the resourcegroup testgroup

maml:description.maml:para: Resumes an instance of Analysis Services server
The Resume-AzureRmAnalysisServicesServer cmdlet resumes an instance of Analysis Services server

Name of the Azure resource group to which the server belongs
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.

Describes the actions the current operation will perform without actually performing them

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command will resume a paused server named testserver in the resourcegroup testgroup

maml:description.maml:para: Modifies an instance of Analysis Services server
The Set-AzureRmAnalysisServicesServer cmdlet modifies an instance of Analysis Services server

maml:Description.maml:para: Name of the Analysis Services server
Name of the Azure resource group to which the server belongs
The name of the Sku for the server. The supported values are 'S0', 'S1', 'S2', 'S4' for the Standard tier; 'B1', 'B2' for the Basic tier and 'D1' for Development tier.
Key-value pairs in the form of a hash table set as tags on the server.

A string representing a comma separated list of users or groups to be set as administrators on the server. The users or groups need to be specified UPN format e.g. user@contoso.com or groups@contoso.com
The blob container Uri for backup the Analysis Services server
Default connection mode of an Analysis service server
The credentials, account, tenant, and subscription used for communication with azure.
Firewall config of an Analysis server
Gateway resource Id for assocaite to an Analysis server
Will return the deleted server details if the operation completes successfully
Read only replica count of an Analysis service server
Prompts user to confirm whether to perform the operation
Describes the actions the current operation will perform without actually performing them

Name of the Azure resource group to which the server belongs
The name of the Sku for the server. The supported values are 'S0', 'S1', 'S2', 'S4' for the Standard tier; 'B1', 'B2' for the Basic tier and 'D1' for Development tier.
Key-value pairs in the form of a hash table set as tags on the server.

A string representing a comma separated list of users or groups to be set as administrators on the server. The users or groups need to be specified UPN format e.g. user@contoso.com or groups@contoso.com

maml:description.maml:para: Tests the existence of an instance of Analysis Services server
The Test-AzureRmAnalysisServicesServer cmdlet tests the existence of an instance of Analysis Services server
